subNodes.conversationText: [The crypt appears to lead into a long corridor on the other side of this locked gate. If the thick dust is any indication, this part of the keep has not been used for many years.]
[You carefully undo the rusty mechanism that latches the gate in place.]
It does not seem to me as if we have a reason to be doing this.
Do not question my decision, Ianth.

I happen to agree with in this. I mean, this is the crypt where my brother is buried--if anyone had reason to complain, it would be me. But I remain content--pleased, even. Adventure is not for the overly scrupulous.
Well, be glad that I worship Sune, and not Tyr.
Indeed.  Perhaps we will find an antique silk chemise for you.
Such a thing would fit you far better than I.
In any case, <FirstName>, let us get this over with.
[Try as you might, the rusty mechanism holding the gate's latch in place will not move.]
[Break the latch holding the gate in place.]
[The latch clatters to the floor, and the gate opens easily.]
Yes, you might as well have an expert take a look at it.
It does not seem to me as if we have a reason to be doing this.
Do not question my decision, Ianth.

I happen to agree with in this. I mean, this is the crypt where my brother is buried--if anyone had reason to complain, it would be me. But I remain content--pleased, even. Adventure is not for the overly scrupulous.
Well, be glad that I worship Sune, and not Tyr.
Indeed.  Perhaps we will find an antique silk chemise for you.
Such a thing would fit you far better than I.
In any case, <FirstName>, let us get this over with.
[Vroman undoes the latch holding the gate in place in no time.]
I'm surprised you can't handle this one yourself!  Well, let me take a look.
[You carefully undo the rusty mechanism that latches the gate in place.]
It does not seem to me as if we have a reason to be doing this.
Do not question my decision, Ianth.
